sen.j: 藤原 邦綱（ふじわら の くにつな、保安 (元号)3年（1122年） - 治承5年閏2月23日 (旧暦)（1181年4月8日））は平安時代後期の公卿。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Kunitsuna (1122 - April 8, 1181) was a court noble in the late Heian period.
FUJIWARA no Kunitsuna (1122 - April 8, 1181) was a court noble during the late Heian period.
FUJIWARA no Kunitsuna (1122 - April 8, 1181) was a court noble during the late Heian period.

sen.j: 父は右馬権助・藤原盛国、母は散位・藤原公長の女
sen.e: His father was FUJIWARA no Morikuni, Uma no gon no suke (Asst. Provisional Captain of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses), while his mother was a daughter of FUJIWARA no Kinnaga, Sani (courtier without post).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: His father was FUJIWARA no Morikuni, Uma no gon no suke (Asst. Provisional Captain of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses), while his mother was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Kinnaga, Sani (courtier without a post).

His father was FUJIWARA no Morikuni, Uma no gon no suke (Asst. Provisional Captain of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses), while his mother was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Kinnaga, Sani (courtier without a post).

sen.j: 子に泰季（実父・高階仲親）、重邦、基能、清邦（平清盛の養子）、藤原成子（六条天皇乳母）、邦子（高倉天皇乳母・藤原成頼室）、藤原輔子（安徳天皇乳母・平重衡室）、藤原綱子（平徳子乳母）がいる。
sen.e: His children were Yasusue (a real son of TAKASHINA no Nakachika), Shigekuni, Motoyoshi, Kiyokuni (adopted into a son of TAIRA no Kiyomori), FUJIWARA no Nariko (Emperor Rokujo's menoto (a woman providing breast-feed to a highborn baby)), FUJIWARA no Kuniko (Emperor Takakura's menoto and FUJIWARA no Nariyori's wife), FUJIWARA no Hoshi (Emperor Antoku's menoto and TAIRA no Shigehira's wife), and FUJIWARA no Tsunako (TAIRA no Tokuko's menoto).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処（実父・高階仲親）のカッコ内を文章にせずつなげるため、高階仲親の実子と訳してあります。
sen.e: His children were Yasusue (a real son of TAKASHINA no Nakachika), Shigekuni, Motoyoshi, Kiyokuni (adopted as the son of TAIRA no Kiyomori), FUJIWARA no Nariko (Emperor Rokujo's menoto - a woman providing breast-feed to a highborn baby), FUJIWARA no Kuniko (Emperor Takakura's menoto and FUJIWARA no Nariyori's wife), FUJIWARA no Hoshi (Emperor Antoku's menoto and TAIRA no Shigehira's wife), and FUJIWARA no Tsunako (TAIRA no Tokuko's menoto).

His children were Yasusue (a real son of TAKASHINA no Nakachika), Shigekuni, Motoyoshi, Kiyokuni (adopted as the son of TAIRA no Kiyomori), FUJIWARA no Nariko (Emperor Rokujo's menoto - a woman providing breast-feed to a highborn baby), FUJIWARA no Kuniko (Emperor Takakura's menoto and FUJIWARA no Nariyori's wife), FUJIWARA no Hoshi (Emperor Antoku's menoto and TAIRA no Shigehira's wife), and FUJIWARA no Tsunako (TAIRA no Tokuko's menoto).

sen.j: 藤原良門流藤原氏の系統に属する下級官人だったが、大学寮から蔵人になる一方で藤原忠通の家司として頭角を現わす。
sen.e: Belonging to the family line of FUJIWARA no Yoshikado in the FUJIWARA clan, a lower-ranking government official class, he served as Daigaku-ryo (Bureau of Education under the ritsuryo system) and Kurodo (Chamberlain) but distinguished himself as a Keishi (household superintendent) of FUJIWARA no Tadamichi.

Belonging to the family line of FUJIWARA no Yoshikado in the FUJIWARA clan, a lower-ranking government official class, he served as Daigaku-ryo (Bureau of Education under the ritsuryo system) and Kurodo (Chamberlain) but distinguished himself as a Keishi (household superintendent) of FUJIWARA no Tadamichi.

Belonging to the FUJIWARA no Yoshikado line of the FUJIWARA clan, a lower-ranking government official class, he served as Daigaku-ryo (Bureau of Education under the ritsuryo system) and Kurodo (Chamberlain) but distinguished himself as a Keishi (household superintendent) of FUJIWARA no Tadamichi.
sen.cmt: 「family line of FUJIWARA no Yoshikado in the FUJIWARA clan」→「FUJIWARA no Yoshikado line of the FUJIWARA clan」

sen.j: 和泉国・越後国・伊予国・播磨国の受領を歴任して財力を蓄え、永万元年（1165年）破格ともいえる蔵人頭に補される。
sen.e: While he was serving as Zuryo (the head of the provincial governors) of the Provinces of Izum, Echigo, Iyo, and Harima, he made a fortune and got an exceptional promotion to Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain) in 1165.

While he was serving as Zuryo (the head of the provincial governors) of the Provinces of Izum, Echigo, Iyo, and Harima, he made a fortune and received an exceptional promotion to Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain) in 1165.

While he was serving as Zuryo (the head of the provincial governors) of the Provinces of Izumi, Echigo, Iyo, and Harima, he made a fortune and received an exceptional promotion to Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain) in 1165.

sen.j: 4人の娘を六条・高倉・安徳三天皇及び高倉中宮・徳子の乳母として、その豊かな財力で養育に力を尽くした。
sen.e: He had his four daughters become the menoto of three Emperors--Rokujo, Takakura, and Antoku--and the Empress Takakura, Tokuko and contribute to their upbringing using his great wealth.
He had his four daughters become the menoto of three Emperors--Rokujo, Takakura, and Antoku--and the Empress Takakura, Tokuko and contributed to their upbringing using his great wealth.
He had his four daughters become the menoto of three Emperors--Rokujo, Takakura, and Antoku--and the Empress Takakura, Tokuko and contributed to their upbringing using his great wealth.

sen.j: 平氏と親密な関係を深め白河殿盛子（関白・近衛基実室）の後見をつとめた。
sen.e: He strengthened a tie with the Taira clan and acted as a guardian for Shirakawa dono (TAIRA no) Seishi (the wife of Motozane KONOE, Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor)).
He strengthened ties with the Taira clan and acted as a guardian for Shirakawa dono (TAIRA no) Seishi (the wife of Motozane KONOE, Kanpaku - chief adviser to the Emperor).
He strengthened ties with the Taira clan and acted as a guardian for Shirakawa dono (TAIRA no) Seishi (the wife of Motozane KONOE, Kanpaku - chief adviser to the Emperor).

sen.j: 仁安 (日本)元年（1166年）基実が没すると多くの摂関家領を盛子に相続させた。
sen.e: When Motozane died in 1166, he was successful in having many territories of the Sekkan-ke (line of regents and advisers) inherited to Seishi.
When Motozane died in 1166, he was successful in having many territories of the Sekkan-ke (line of regents and advisers) inherited to Seishi.
When Motozane died in 1166, he was successful in having many territories of the Sekkan-ke (line of regents and advisers) inherited to Seishi.

sen.j: これについて九条兼実は「平禅門の藤氏を滅亡する、此の人頗る其の事に与る」（『玉葉』治承5年閏2月23日条）と非難している。
sen.e: Kanezane KUJO criticized this by saying "平禅門の藤氏を滅亡する、此の人頗る其の事に与る" in Gyokuyo (Kanezane KUJO's diary), February 23, 1179).
sen.cmt: 「平禅門の藤氏を滅亡する、此の人頗る其の事に与る」は訳し出しできませんでした。
sen.e: Kanezane KUJO criticized this by saying "平禅門の藤氏を滅亡する、此の人頗る其の事に与る" in Gyokuyo (Kanezane KUJO's diary), February 23, 1179).

Kanezane KUJO criticized this in an entry in Gyokuyo (the name given to his diary) that he made on February 23, 1179, in which he said: "He is willingly trying to extinguish the line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan".

sen.j: 権大納言まで昇進し公卿に列したが、邦綱の系統では平安前期の藤原兼輔以来だった。
sen.e: He was promoted to Gon Dainagon (a provisional major counselor), a member of the court nobles; it was the first time for his family line to get advanced to such a high position since FUJIWARA no Kanesuke had taken it in the early Heian Period.

He was promoted to Gon Dainagon (a provisional major counselor), a member of the court nobles; it was the first time for his family line to be advanced to such a high position since FUJIWARA no Kanesuke had been promoted during the early Heian Period.

He was promoted to Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state), a member of the court nobles; it was the first time for his family line to be advanced to such a high position since FUJIWARA no Kanesuke had been promoted during the early Heian Period.
sen.cmt: 他の記事に用語を統一

sen.j: 子を清盛の養子にするなど、清盛から信頼され「平大相国とさしも契深う、心ざし浅からざりし人なり」（『平家物語』）といわれた。
sen.e: Kiyomori adopted his son, which shows his trust in Kunitsuna was great, and Heike Monogatari (the tale of the Heike) describes: "平大相国とさしも契深う、心ざし浅からざりし人なり."
sen.cmt: 「平大相国とさしも契深う、心ざし浅からざりし人なり」は訳し出しできませんでした。
sen.e: Kiyomori adopted his son, which shows his trust in Kunitsuna was great, and Heike Monogatari (the tale of the Heike) describes: "平大相国とさしも契深う、心ざし浅からざりし人なり."

Kiyomori's adoption of Kunitsuna's son showed how greatly he trusted Kunitsuna, and Heike Monogatari (the tale of the Heike) described Kunitsuna as follows: "He is deeply involved with TAIRA Dajo-daijin (Grand minister of state) and he has great ambition."

sen.j: 第宅も数多く有し、土御門東洞院第は後白河天皇の御所及び六条・高倉両天皇の里内裏として、五条第は高倉天皇の里内裏に用いられた。
sen.e: Among many Teitaku (residences) he owned, the Tsuchimikado Higashinotoin-tei (residence) was used for a Gosho (Palace) of the Emperor Goshirakawa and for a Satodairi (a temporary palace) of the Emperors of Rokujo and Takakura, while the Gojo-tei (residence) was used for a Satodairi of the Emperor Takakura.

Among many Teitaku (residences) he owned, the Tsuchimikado Higashinotoin-tei (residence) that was used for a Gosho (Palace) of the Emperor Goshirakawa and for a Satodairi (a temporary palace) of the Emperors of Rokujo and Takakura, while the Gojo-tei (residence) was used for a Satodairi for Emperor Takakura.

Among many Teitaku (residences) he owned, the Tsuchimikado Higashinotoin-tei (residence) that was used for a Gosho (Palace) of the Emperor Goshirakawa and for a Satodairi (a temporary palace) of the Emperors of Rokujo and Takakura, while the Gojo-tei (residence) was used for a Satodairi for Emperor Takakura.

sen.j: 高倉上皇の第一の側近として厳島御幸や、遷都が計画された福原京福原行幸に供奉した。
sen.e: He accompanied the retired Emperor Takakura's visit to Itsukushima and Fukuhara-kyo (Capital of Fukuhara), the planned capital relocation site, as the closest aide.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He accompanied the retired Emperor Takakura's visit to Itsukushima and Fukuhara-kyo (Capital of Fukuhara), the planned capital relocation site, as the closest aide.
He accompanied the retired Emperor Takakura's visit to Itsukushima and Fukuhara-kyo (Capital of Fukuhara), the planned capital relocation site, as the closest aide.

sen.j: 高倉崩御に際しては素服を賜わった。
sen.e: When the Emperor Takakura died,. he was given sofuku (white clothes) for mourning.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: When Emperor Takakura died,. he was given sofuku (white clothes) for mourning.
When Emperor Takakura died,. he was given sofuku (white clothes) for mourning.

sen.j: 公卿でこの恩遇にあずかったのは、邦綱の他には平宗盛・平時忠・藤原隆季・土御門通親の4人だけだった。
sen.e: Among court nobles, given such a treatment were only Kunitsuna and other four nobles--TAIRA no Munemori, TAIRA no Tokitada, FUJIWARA no Takasue, and Michichika TSUCHIMIKADO.
Among court nobles, treated in such a way, were only Kunitsuna and four other nobles--TAIRA no Munemori, TAIRA no Tokitada, FUJIWARA no Takasue, and Michichika TSUCHIMIKADO.
Among court nobles, treated in such a way, were only Kunitsuna and four other nobles--TAIRA no Munemori, TAIRA no Tokitada, FUJIWARA no Takasue, and Michichika TSUCHIMIKADO.

sen.j: やがて清盛も没し、後を追うように治承5年（1181年）閏2月23日に死去した。
sen.e: Before long Kiyomori died, and FUJIWARA no Kunitsuna died on February 23, 1181 as if following Kiyomori.
Before long Kiyomori died, and FUJIWARA no Kunitsuna died on February 23, 1181 as if following Kiyomori.
Before long Kiyomori died, and FUJIWARA no Kunitsuna died on February 23, 1181 as if following Kiyomori.

sen.j: 訃報を聞いた兼実は下記（『玉葉』治承5年閏2月23日条）のように評した。
sen.e: Hearing of his death, Kanezane wrote in Gyokuyo (Kanezane KUJO's diary), February 23, 1179) as below:
sen.cmt: 語順を変更しました。一原文一訳文例外処理
sen.e: Hearing of his death, Kanezane wrote in Gyokuyo (Kanezane KUJO's diary), February 23, 1179) as below:
Hearing of his death, Kanezane wrote in Gyokuyo (Kanezane KUJO's diary), February 23, 1179) as below:

sen.j: 「邦綱卿は卑賤より出ずと雖も其の心広大なり。」
sen.cmt: 「邦綱卿は卑賤より出ずと雖も其の心広大なり。」訳出できませんでした。一原文一訳文例外処理
sen.e: Kunitsuna was from a humble background but he was generous of heart.

sen.j: 「天下の諸人貴賎を論ぜず、其の経営を以て偏に身の大事となす。」
sen.cmt: 「天下の諸人貴賎を論ぜず、其の経営を以て偏に身の大事となす。」訳し出しできませんでした。一原文一訳文例外処理
sen.e: He did not judge people based on their occupation, only on their progress.

sen.j: 「ここに因りて衆人惜しまざるはなし」
sen.cmt: 「ここに因りて衆人惜しまざるはなし」訳し出しできませんでした。
sen.e: It is certain that he will be missed by many.
